marketNews.title: Danantara Prepares Rp210 Trillion Credit Ceiling for Merah Putih Village Cooperatives
marketNews.content:
The Deputy Minister of Cooperatives, Farida Farichah, stated that Danantara has agreed to provide a credit ceiling of 210 trillion rupiah for the development of approximately 80,000 units of Merah Putih Village Cooperatives (KDMP). Farida explained that Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) will each manage 66 trillion rupiah, while the remaining 12 trillion rupiah will be placed in Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS). See the table above to see the comparison of these ceilings against the current loan and third-party fund positions of the state-owned bank group (Himbara).
Danantara itself has not commented on Farida's statement, so the source of funds for the ceiling is not clearly known. Previously, the Minister of Cooperatives, Ferry Juliantono, in early October 2025 conveyed that Danantara and the Ministry of Finance would channel additional funds to KDMP in order to accelerate physical development as well as operational needs for outlets and warehousing. The CEO of Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, explained that the support from the Ministry of Finance will be channeled through the State Budget (APBN), while the Director General at the Ministry of Finance, Askolani, mentioned that the allocation can be taken from regional transfer budgets or other spending posts. In the Draft State Budget and Financial Notes for 2026, it is mentioned that the KDMP program will be given support of 83 trillion rupiah from the APBN to be channeled through Himbara.
To date, financing for KDMP that has been executed also involves Himbara, including: 1) placement of the remaining 2025 APBN surplus budget (SAL) amounting to 16 trillion rupiah, with related regulations having been promulgated in early September 2025; and 2) liquidity injection amounting to 200 trillion rupiah in early September 2025, which includes an incentive for interest cost reduction from ~3.8% to 2% if these funds are used for the disbursement of KDMP credit.
These latest KDMP developments follow reports of a delay in the program's implementation timeline. Most recently, the government targeted the completion and operation of physical infrastructure development for approximately 80,000 KDMP by March 2026, delayed from the initial target this month. As of Tuesday (28/10), only 22,351 KDMP have been declared active, equivalent to 28% of the government's target. Meanwhile, 82,246 KDMP have legal status, with 16,485 cooperatives already having outlets.

Key Takeaway
We assess that the discourse on KDMP funding from Danantara has the potential to become a positive sentiment for Himbara because it will provide assurance that the execution risk and profitability of the KDMP program will not burden bank capital. However, there are no details yet regarding the scheme for placing the 210 trillion rupiah fund into Himbara, including the placement interest rate (if any). From the debtor's side, the KDMP credit interest rate has been set at 6% with a maximum financing of 3 billion rupiah per cooperative and a maximum tenor of 72 months.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump Offers 0% Import Tariff for Palm Oil, Coffee, Cocoa, and Rubber Commodities from Malaysia, Cambodia, and Thailand
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, provided a 0% import tariff for a number of commodities including palm oil, coffee, cocoa, and rubber from Malaysia, Cambodia, and Thailand. Meanwhile, the export tariff for other goods from these three countries remains at the 19% level. The agreement was signed at the ASEAN Summit in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia last weekend. The US also signed agreements with Malaysia and Thailand to strengthen cooperation in critical mineral supply chains.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa States Intent to Avoid Burden Sharing with Bank Indonesia to Maintain Central Bank Autonomy
marketNews.content: The Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, said on Tuesday (28/10) that he would avoid burden sharing with Bank Indonesia in bearing the costs of government programs as much as possible, as an effort to maintain the central bank's autonomy. Bloomberg reported that Purbaya's statement could serve as a guarantee for investors, who have recently been concerned about new burden sharing policies that could place Bank Indonesia under pressure to support economic growth. Previously, the Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, said in September 2025 that the central bank would purchase government bonds in the secondary market and bear part of the interest costs to help finance President Prabowo Subianto's priority programs in public housing and village cooperatives.

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister Bahlil Lahadalia Assesses DMO Palm Oil Scheme for B50 Biodiesel Mandate Program
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said on Tuesday (28/10) that the government is considering the application of a domestic market obligation (DMO) on palm oil for the raw material supply of the 50% biodiesel blend (B50) program. The DMO policy is one of 3 options currently being considered by the government to balance palm oil exports with domestic needs, with the other 2 options being increasing production or expanding plantations.

marketNews.title: IDX Targets 2026 Daily Transaction Value at Rp 14.5 Trillion and 50 New IPOs
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) targets the average daily transaction value (RNTH) in 2026 to reach 14.5 trillion rupiah, which is +7.4% higher than the 2025 target of 13.5 trillion rupiah. The IDX recorded that the RNTH from the beginning of the year until October 24, 2025 reached 16.46 trillion rupiah, an increase of +28.1% Year to Date (YTD) from the realization at the end of 2024 of 12.85 trillion rupiah. Regarding the listing of new issuers, IDX is targeting 50 IPOs in 2026, up from the revised 2025 target of 45 IPOs. Of the 2026 target, 6 IPOs are targeted to come from lighthouse IPOs.

marketNews.title: 4 Things You Must Understand Before You Can Profit in the Market
marketNews.content: "The market is a cruel but honest teacher. Many are hurt because they came without protection." - JhonWong

tickerNews.title: GOTO 3Q25: Adjusted EBITDA +21% QoQ, 2025 Guidance Revised Upwards
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia recorded an adjusted EBITDA of 516 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+21% QoQ, +239% YoY), bringing the adjusted EBITDA for 9M25 to 1.3 trillion rupiah (vs. 9M24: negative 79 billion rupiah). This operational performance improvement resulted in a net loss in 3Q25 of 255 billion rupiah (vs. 2Q25: loss of 375 billion rupiah, 3Q24: loss of 1.7 trillion rupiah). Revenue in 3Q25 increased to 4.7 trillion rupiah (+9% QoQ, +21% YoY). GOTO management also revised the 2025 adjusted EBITDA guidance upwards from the range of 1.4-1.6 trillion rupiah to the range of 1.8-1.9 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: BUKA 3Q25: Adjusted EBITDA Negative 18 Billion Rupiah, Net Profit Up Driven by Investment Gains
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak recorded an adjusted EBITDA of negative 18 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: negative 14 billion rupiah, 3Q24: negative 168 billion rupiah), resulting in an adjusted EBITDA for 9M25 of negative 53 billion rupiah (vs. 9M24: negative 193 billion rupiah). Net profit was recorded at 2.4 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: 355 billion rupiah, 3Q24: 155 billion rupiah), which was mainly caused by an increase in investment gains to 2.1 trillion rupiah. Revenue was relatively flat quarter-on-quarter, standing at 1.6 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+1% QoQ, +66% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BRMS 3Q25 Net Profit Soars 123% YoY to $15 Million, Driven by Absence of One-off Impairment Loss
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals recorded a net profit of 15 million US dollars in 3Q25 (+76% QoQ, +123% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 38 million US dollars (+142% YoY), in line with expectations as it reaches 75% of the consensus 2025F estimate. The quarterly net profit increase in 3Q25 was mainly driven by the absence of a one-off loss on the impairment of business development projects (vs. 2Q25: loss of 6.5 million US dollars). Operationally, operating profit in 3Q25 decreased quarterly (-13% QoQ, +58% YoY) due to operating costs rising higher (+48% QoQ, +25% YoY) compared to revenue growth (+9% QoQ, +33% YoY). This result brought the operating profit for 9M25 to 70 million US dollars (+144% YoY), still in line with expectations as it equals 75% of the consensus 2025F estimate. Operationally, gold sales were recorded at 17,559 oz in 3Q25 (+3% QoQ, -6% YoY), with an average selling price of 3,402 US dollars per oz (+2% QoQ, +34% YoY). This result brought the total gold sales volume for 9M25 to 56,552 oz (+25% YoY), equivalent to 80-83% of the 2025 production volume target, with an average selling price of 3,156 US dollars per oz (+34% YoY).

tickerNews.title: INCO 3Q25 Net Profit Jumps 688% QoQ to $27 Million, Driven by Nickel Ore Revenue Surge
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia recorded a net profit of 27 million US dollars in 3Q25 (+688% QoQ, +97% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 52 million US dollars (+3% YoY), equivalent to 61% of the consensus 2025F estimate. Operating profit in 3Q25 was recorded at 33 million US dollars in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: 0.4 million US dollars, 3Q24: 7 million US dollars) due to revenue (+27% QoQ, +21% YoY) growing higher than the cost of revenue (+12% QoQ, +11% YoY). The quarterly revenue increase in 3Q25 was mainly driven by nickel ore revenue of 39 million US dollars (vs. 2Q25: 2 million US dollars, 3Q24: none). Operationally, nickel matte sales were recorded at 19,557 tons in 3Q25 (+9% QoQ, +10% YoY), with an average selling price of 12,272 US dollars per ton (+1% QoQ, -5% YoY). Saprolite ore sales volume was recorded at 749 thousand tons in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: 67 thousand tons, 3Q24: none). This resulted in nickel matte sales volume for 9M25 recorded at 54,676 tons (+2% YoY), equivalent to 77% of the 2025 production volume target, with an average selling price of 12,106 US dollars per ton (-9% YoY). Saprolite ore sales volume was recorded at 896 thousand tons in 9M25 (vs. 9M24: none).

tickerNews.title: MYOR 3Q25 Net Profit Rises 129% YoY to Rp 683 Billion, Driven by Margin Improvement and Currency Gains
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah recorded a net profit of 683 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+129% YoY, +43% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 1.85 trillion rupiah (-8% YoY), equivalent to 63% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 67% realization of 2024). The recovery in net profit in 3Q25 was mainly driven by: 1) an increase in operating profit (+17% YoY, +23% QoQ) along with an improvement in gross profit margin (+80-90 bps YoY and QoQ) and moderate opex (-5% YoY, +23% QoQ); and 2) exchange rate gains of 73 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q24: loss of 257 billion rupiah, 2Q25: loss of 10 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: ISAT 3Q25 Net Profit Up 10% YoY to Rp 1.2 Trillion; ARPU Reaches Highest Level in 2025
tickerNews.content: Indosat recorded a net profit of 1.2 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+10% YoY, +22% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 3.5 trillion rupiah (-7% YoY), equivalent to 73% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 79% realization of 2024). Operationally, operating profit for 9M25 decreased by -11% YoY due to a revenue decline (-2% YoY) and an increase in the cost of revenue (+4% YoY), although there was a slight improvement in 3Q25. In 3Q25, revenue increased by +2% YoY and 4% QoQ, mainly driven by the growth of average revenue per user (ARPU) which reached 40,000 rupiah, marking the highest level during 2025. In addition, the operating profit margin in 3Q25 also increased quarterly to 18.4% (vs. 2Q25: 17.7% and 3Q24: 19.6%).

tickerNews.title: TOBA Confirms Non-Participation in Danantara's Waste-to-Energy Plant Auction, Focuses on Existing and Regional Projects
tickerNews.content: The Director of TBS Energi Utama, Juli Oktarina, stated that her company will not participate in the waste-to-energy power plant (PLTSa) auction held by Danantara. Juli explained that the company's current priority is to focus on existing projects and projects located in regional areas. Furthermore, Juli also affirmed that TOBA is not involved in the patriot bonds issued by Danantara.

tickerNews.title: ARTO 3Q25 Net Profit Doubles YoY to Rp 72 Billion, PPOP Jumps 213% YoY Driven by NII and Fee Income Growth
tickerNews.content: Bank Jago recorded a net profit of 72 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+100% YoY, +8% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 199 billion rupiah (+132% YoY), equivalent to 73% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 67% realization of 2024). The surge in net profit during 9M25 was primarily driven by Net Interest Income growth (+65% YoY) and fee income growth (+53% YoY) which was higher than opex (+21% YoY), resulting in a Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) increase of +213% YoY. Total credit and financing grew by +36% YoY as of September 2025, with the Net Interest Margin (NIM) increasing to 8.3% during 9M25 (vs. 9M24: 7.1%).

tickerNews.title: MIDI 3Q25 Net Profit Up 41% YoY to Rp 200 Billion, Driven by Opex Reduction Despite Flat Revenue
tickerNews.content: Midi Utama Indonesia recorded a net profit of 200 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+41% YoY, +0% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 591 billion rupiah (+27% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 79% of the consensus 2025F guidance (vs. 3-year average: ~79%). The annual growth in net profit in 3Q25 was mainly driven by a decrease in opex amidst relatively flat revenue (+0% YoY, +1% QoQ). Revenue in 3Q25 was still supported by growth in areas outside Java (+15% YoY), which was offset by revenue contraction in the Jabodetabek region (-16% YoY) and Java outside Jabodetabek (-5% YoY). Meanwhile, sales expenses and general and administrative expenses in 3Q25 decreased by -5% YoY and -7% YoY, respectively, resulting in annual growth in operating profit of +40% YoY (-2% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: ARNA 3Q25 Net Profit Down 13% YoY to Rp 98 Billion, Gross Margin Compressed by Higher Fabrication Costs
tickerNews.content: Arwana Citramulia recorded a net profit of 98 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-13% YoY, -1% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 302 billion rupiah (-4% YoY), equivalent to ~64% of management's 2025 guidance. Net profit in 3Q25 was mainly suppressed by slowing revenue growth amid an increase in the cost of revenue due to higher fabrication costs (+27% YoY, +1% QoQ) and raw materials (+11% YoY, -5% QoQ), causing the gross profit margin in 3Q25 to decline annually to 29.6% (vs. 3Q24: 34.6%, 2Q25: 29.6%). The operating profit margin also decreased annually to 17.5% (vs. 3Q24: 20%, 2Q25: 17.4%) amidst a decrease in opex (-11% YoY, +1% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: CUAN's Subsidiary Acquires 1.5 Million Shares of PTRO, Increasing Stake to 45.328%
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi's (CUAN) subsidiary and Petrosea's (PTRO) controller, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, purchased approximately 1.5 million shares of PTRO at an average price of approximately 6,538 rupiah per share on October 28, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 10 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership in PTRO increased from 45.313% to 45.328%.

tickerNews.title: HRTA Signs Cooperation Agreement with Bank Muamalat for Gold Supply
tickerNews.content: Hartadinata Abadi (HRTA) signed a cooperation agreement with Bank Muamalat for the provision and delivery of gold for customers, which includes the purchase of 99.99% purity Emasku branded gold bars. HRTA stated that this collaboration is expected to strengthen the company's position in the precious metals market, as well as encourage increased operational performance.

tickerNews.title: TBIG Transfers Treasury Shares Equivalent to ~1.5% to Controller at Rp 2,138 per Share
tickerNews.content: Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBIG) announced that the company has transferred all of its treasury shares equivalent to approximately 1.5% of the total shares to its controller, Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia Pte. Ltd. The transaction was conducted at a price of 2,138 rupiah per share or a total value of approximately 749 billion rupiah, which is about +14.9% higher than TBIG's share price as of Wednesday (29/10).

tickerNews.title: KKGI Appointed as Initiator for Bener Dam Mini-Hydro Power Plant Project in Purworejo
tickerNews.content: Resource Alam Indonesia (KKGI) announced that the Ministry of Public Works has appointed the company as the initiator for the Bener Dam mini-hydro power plant (PLTM) project in Purworejo, Central Java. This 96 billion rupiah project will generate electricity of 6-10 MW, with a plan to sell electricity to PLN Central Java region. KKGI stated that the feasibility study related to this project has been completed and is awaiting approval from the Ministry of Public Works. KKGI also explained that the company has the right to match in the project tender process to be held by the Ministry of Public Works.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Controller and President Director Purchases 3 Million Shares, Increasing Direct Stake to 1.14%
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Director of Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC), Haryanto Tjiptodihardjo, purchased 3 million IMPC shares at an average price of 2,273 rupiah per share on October 28, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 6.8 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Haryanto Tjiptodihardjo's direct ownership portion in IMPC increased from 1.13% to 1.14%.

tickerNews.title: BUAH Plans to Distribute 2025 Interim Dividend of Rp 25 Billion, Indicating ~1.7% Dividend Yield
tickerNews.content: Segar Kumala Indonesia (BUAH) plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to 25 billion rupiah or 12.5 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~1.7% as of Wednesday (29/10). The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 6, 2025, with payment on November 28, 2025.
